--- In nbwrpg@y..., "Jonathan" <jhogan@r...> wrote:
> (OOC)
> 
>     Dew I did respond. Look back through the posts, Talos addressed 
your
> "surrender" alongside giving out jobs to the maximals that had 
reported in.
> 
> In plain summary, he doesn't really give a slag what you may or may 
not have
> done. Fact of it is, Sunhawk is there, there's a mission to 
complete and he
> doesn't have time throwing your skid plate in the brig so get to 
work or get
> to a CR chamber if you're injured.
> 
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: "dewboy30816" <dewboy30816@y...>

> 
> > Sunhawk realized he still looked threatening so he threw down his
> > gun, the belt around his waist with extra clips, and the 2 belts
> > around his chest with exploding and gas grenades.  He then 
reextended
> > his hands for the cuffs praying by some miricle he wasn't going 
to be
> > rearrested soon.
> >
> > --- In nbwrpg@y..., "dewboy30816" <dewboy30816@y...> wrote:
> > > Sunhawk tried to resist.  He knew they'd arrest him if they 
knew he
> > > was on board.  They no doubt had his wanted posters on hand.
> > Still,
> > > the training as a Maximal soilder couldn't be fought.  He had to
> > > respond.  From the crate in the next room he called.
> > >
> > > Sunhawk:  EX-LUTIENENT FIRST CLASS SUNHAWK OF THE AGENDA WARS
> > PRESENT
> > > SIR!
> > >
> > > He lifted out, walked into the room with the captain, saluted, 
and
> > > extended his hand for the handcuffs.
> > >
> > > Sunhawk:  By the way I didn't steal those files and I would 
NEVER
> > > have killed her no matter what the courts said at my trial.
> > >
> > > --- In nbwrpg@y..., "Jonathan" <jhogan@r...> wrote:
> > > > {Talos}
> > > > Maximal Exploritory Vessel, Aragorn: Bridge
> > > > Morning
> > > >
> > > > The smoke filled his optics, blinding him, the sizzle and
> > sparking
> > > panels
> > > > flashed as his vision cleared the sounds of smaller explosions
> > > within his
> > > > ship told him the crash had been a bad one. He looked around 
at
> > the
> > > others
> > > > strewn about in the crash. Some he knew would never rise 
again,
> > > others had
> > > > already begun to move, to shake off the effects of the forced
> > > landing.
> > > > "Everyone who isn't deactivated sound off."
> > > >
> > > >     His words while commanding were spoken lightly, no need to
> > > shoutat them
> > > > yet after the crash. Sitting up in his chair he reached out
> > > touching a comm
> > > > button, frowning at the crackle and hiss as he opened the 
line to
> > > the
> > > > thruster section of the frigate. Smacking the panel with his
> > > metallic fist
> > > > he was rewarded by the ping of connection, "Engineering 
report,
> > how
> > > bad's
> > > > the damage...can we lift off again anytime soon?"
> > > >
> > > >     Shaking the last few webs of energon from his memory 
circuits
> > > he got a
> > > > good look outside the ships main window, or at least the 
massive
> > > shattered
> > > > remains of the window. Outside the sky was clear and clouds
> > covered
> > > the sky
> > > > in fluffy patches. At least they didn't land in the middle of 
a
> > > desert,
> > > > that's all they needed, sand in their joints, or worse,
> > snow....he
> > > didn't
> > > > mind cold weather assignments so much it's just he disliked 
snow
> > > itself and
> > > > the cold that came with it....
> > > >
> > > >     Shaking his head again he frowned, that window needed
> > repairing
> > > if they
> > > > were gonna lift off again, the blast doors that sheilded them
> > could
> > > still be
> > > > working but flying based on sensors alone was always risky.
> > > Touching the
> > > > communication button again, "Engineering, status on thrusters 
and
> > > general
> > > > ship systems."
> > > >
> > > > (OOC)
